div.p: If \(\rho \geqslant 1\) and the buffer is infinite then a steady-state solution does not exist and the M/M/1 queue is not an ergodic system. If \(\rho \lt 1\) or if \(\rho \geqslant 1\) but the buffer is finite, then a steady-state solution does exist and the M/M/1 queue is an ergodic system.
